title: ​​​Check twice, submit once​
summary: This page provides guidance on how to submit a complete, 'decision ready' visa application to ensure faster processing. It outlines common requirements, document preparation tips, and steps for using ImmiAccount for online visa applications.

key_messages: Get your visa application right the first time for faster processing.
Ensure all required documents and correct information are included at the time of application.
Submit applications well ahead of travel plans.

visa_application_categories.message: Join your family sooner than expected.

document_requirements: Ensure all required documents and correct information are included when applying.
Translate all non-English documents into English.
If in Australia, include the translator's NAATI practitioner number.
If outside Australia, include the translator’s full name, address, phone number, and qualifications in the translated language.
Check that your name is spelled correctly and matches the passport used for the application.
Check for autocorrect issues and list all names you have previously been known by.
under_18_requirements: Submit a copy of your passport.
Submit copies of each parent’s passport.

police_certificates.validity: Certificates must have been issued within the 12 months before applying.

health_checks.requirement: Most visa applications require a health check.
health_checks.option: Applicants may be able to get their health check before applying using the My Health Declarations Service.
health_checks.access: Accessible through 'Check when to have health examinations'.

immiaccount_monitoring: Check your ImmiAccount inbox regularly for updates and requests.
Respond quickly to requests for information to avoid delays.
If you cannot provide requested information, notify the department and explain why.
decision_ready_application_tips.biometric_data: Get biometric data collected promptly once requested.
submission_timing: Submit applications well ahead of intended travel.
Book flights only after visa grant.

steps_to_find_visa_document_requirements: Visit Department of Home Affairs website.
Enter the visa subclass number into the search bar (e.g., Visitor subclass 600).
Select the webpage for the chosen visa subclass.
Navigate to 'gather your documents', click 'show steps', then click through the 'see how' options.

immiaccount_information.description: ImmiAccount is the required platform for applying for most Australian visas.
immiaccount_information.setup_tip: Choose to receive electronic communication when creating an account.
functions: Track the progress of an application.
related_links: Learn how to create an ImmiAccount or login.
